intro: Matelea rhynchocephala, commonly known as the Mexican candlestick plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, candle-like inflorescence composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Matelea rhynchocephala is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
